data.title: Decryption using Vigenère cipher
data.solution:
import sys

encrypted_text_length = int(input())  # The length of the ecrypted message.
encrypted_text = input()  # The ecrypted message.
key_length = int(input())  # The length of secret key.
key = input()  # The secret key.

print("Debug messages...", file=sys.stderr, flush=True)

plaintext = ''
for i in range(encrypted_text_length):
    c = encrypted_text[i]
    k = key[i%key_length]

    if c.isalpha():
        C = c.upper()
        K = k.upper()

        shift = ord(K)-ord('A')
        new_letter = chr( ord('A') + (ord(C)-ord('A') - shift) % (ord('Z')-ord('A')+1) )
        plaintext += new_letter
    else:
        plaintext += c

print(plaintext)
data.statement:
This puzzle is based on <<Vigenère cipher>>.

An encrypted message, a secret key and their lengths are given.
The corresponding plaintext message must be computed.

<<Encryption procedure:>>
Every letter of a plaintext message is shifted and becomes another letter.
The shift depends on the  corresponding key letter (same index).
A => no shift.
B => shift of one letter in the alphabetical order.
C => shift of two letters...
If the key is shorter than the message then the key is repeated.

<</!\>> The encryption procedure is explained, however in this puzzle the encrypted messages (input) should be <<DEcrypted>>!

Only uppercase letters are used for the key.
Only letters are transformed by the decryption process, other characters remain unaffected.
Lowercase letters should be converted to uppercase letters.

Goal

This puzzle is based on Vigenère cipher.

An encrypted message, a secret key and their lengths are given.
The corresponding plaintext message must be computed.

Encryption procedure:
Every letter of a plaintext message is shifted and becomes another letter.
The shift depends on the corresponding key letter (same index).
A => no shift.
B => shift of one letter in the alphabetical order.
C => shift of two letters...
If the key is shorter than the message then the key is repeated.

/!\ The encryption procedure is explained, however in this puzzle the encrypted messages (input) should be DEcrypted!

Only uppercase letters are used for the key.
Only letters are transformed by the decryption process, other characters remain unaffected.
Lowercase letters should be converted to uppercase letters.
Input
Line 1 :length of the encrypted message.
Line 2 :encrypted message.
Line 3 :length of the secret key.
Line 4 :secret key.
Output
Line 1 :plaintext (decrypted) message.
Constraints
Only uppercase letters are given for the key.
Example
Input
11
IFMMP WORLD
11
BBBBBBAAAAA
Output
HELLO WORLD
